page.title: 09CHANGING TIMES
page.content: AN ACCOUNT BY LINDA OKORO. The Broadway shops were scattered among fields in 1924 e.g.the Post Office was a field, Woolworths was a cinema, the Abbey National was a garage,there was nothing on the corner until the bank was built. There was no road from Hendon except Milespit Hill, The Ridgeway and Bunns Lane. The railway brought passengers and freight from St.Pancras to Bedford passing Mill Hill Broadway Station which was then called the 'Midland Station'. There was also a railway line (now extinct) joining Finchley to Edgware calling in at the stations of Mill Hill East and the Hale. At this time there were no houses in Lawrence Street,except St.Joseph's Seminary,The Forge,Holcombe House and some farm cottages.The Priory on the Ridgeway was occupied by a Mr.Hudson.
